meanings.definition: To pile up or heap up.
meanings.sent1: She upheaps the books on the shelf neatly.
meanings.sent2: He upheaps the sand to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel upheaps the acorns in a messy pile.
meanings.sent4: The gardener upheaps the soil to plant new flowers.
meanings.sent5: The child upheaps the blocks to create a tower.

meanings.sent1: The leaves upheaps in the corner of the yard.
meanings.sent2: Snow upheaps on the mountain during winter.
meanings.sent3: The laundry upheaps in a big pile waiting to be folded.
meanings.sent4: Emotions upheaps in her heart as she reads the letter.
meanings.sent5: The toys upheaps in the playroom after a day of fun.
